title: Seasonal Demand Patterns and Revenue Optimization in Coffee Retail
abstract: We analyze seasonal demand patterns across 250 coffee shop locations over 3 years. Winter months (Oct-Feb) show 18-25% higher transaction volumes. Temperature drops of 10°F correlate with 8% increase in hot beverage sales. Regional variations significant (p<0.05).
key_findings: 18-25% higher sales volume in winter months
Temperature inversely correlated with hot beverage sales (r=-0.73)
Weekend traffic patterns differ by 35% from weekdays
Regional preferences vary significantly (ANOVA F=12.4, p<0.001)
methods: Time series decomposition, ARIMA modeling, geographic analysis
